relation: configure terminal Example: Router# configure terminal
interface atm slot / port Example: Router(config)# interface atm 2/0
bundle bundle-name Example: Router(config-if)# bundle bundle-test
selection-method {qos-group | tos-exp} Example: Router(config-if-atm-bundle)# selection-method qos-group
Enables privileged EXEC mode. Enter your password if prompted.

Specifies the ATM interface type and enters interface configuration mode. To determine the correct form of the interface atm command, see your ATM network module, port adapter, or router documentation.
Creates a PVC bundle or modifies an existing PVC bundle and enters ATM bundle configuration mode.
Specifies the method for selection of PVC bundle members.
Ends the configuration session and returns to privileged EXEC mode.
pageTitle: Broadband Access Aggregation and DSL Configuration Guide, Cisco IOS Release 12.4T - Routed Bridge Encapsulation with ATM Virtual Circuit Bundles [Cisco IOS Software Releases 12.4 T] - Cisco
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {59194=RBE --routed bridge encapsulation. Process by which a stub-bridged segment is terminated on a point-to-point routed interface. Specifically, the router is routing on an IEEE 802.3 or Ethernet header carried over a point-to-point protocol, such as PPP, RFC 1483 ATM, or RFC 1490 Frame Relay.}
textBeforeTable: DETAILED STEPS 6.    end 5.    selection-method {qos-group | tos-exp} 4.    bundle bundle-name 3.    interface atm slot / port 2.    configure terminal 1.    enable SUMMARY STEPS You can change the selection method from ToS or EXP to QoS groups only if no PVC bundle member has precedence, protection, or bumping configured. You can change the selection method from QoS groups to ToS or EXP only if no PVC bundle member has QoS groups or Inverse Address Resolution Protocol (InverseARP) configured. Note The selection methods are mutually exclusive. This means that when the selection method based on QoS groups is specified on any PVC bundle member, no other selection method is allowed on the same PVC bundle. Similarly, if the selection method based on ToS or EXP is specified on any PVC bundle member, no other selection method is allowed on the same PVC bundle. ToS or EXP--Use ToS
textAfterTable: Configuring the QoS Group-Based Method for Selection of PVC Bundle Members Perform this task to configure the method for selection of PVC bundle members that is based on QoS groups. Before You Begin You must associate a QoS group or groups with a PVC bundle member. You can specify a QoS group, a range of QoS groups, or any combination of QoS groups and ranges of QoS groups. SUMMARY STEPS 1.    enable 2.    configure terminal 3.    interface atm slot / port 4.    bundle bundle-name 5.    selection-method qos-group 6.    pvc vpi / vci 7.    qos-group qos-groups 8.    end DETAILED STEPS   Command or Action Purpose
